intro: Euphrasia latifolia var. submollis, commonly known as the broad-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are broad and have a soft, velvety texture, which gives it its varietal name "submollis." Euphrasia latifolia var. submollis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
